page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area of twelve square kilometres is covered with fields. The fields are mainly grass fields for growing silage and hay, or grazing cows and sheep. Some crops are grown in the area, mostly barley and swedes for animal feed, and potatoes. There is a small river, the{River {Bray,}running down the east side from north to south. It is about five metres wide at{Clapworthy Mill,}and about half a metre deep. Salmon, trout and sea-trout are caught in the river. Seven streams run off our area into the River Bray. Three other streams flow west towards the River Taw. There are very few people living in the area because there are no villages or towns. Most people either work on the farms or work in South Molton which is nearby, to the east.
